required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Conventional Photodynamic Therapy vs. Painless Photodynamic Therapy for Actinic Keratosis
clinical_study.official_title: Conventional Photodynamic Therapy vs. Painless Photodynamic Therapy for Actinic Keratosis#a Randomized, Open-label Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being done to compare a new, continuous illumination and short Incubation time regimen of aminolevulinic acid photodynamic therapy#ALA-PDT) to a conventional regimen for treatment of Actinic Keratosis. The hypothesis is that the continuous illumination approach will be less or even no painful, but equally efficacious, as the old regimen.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is being done to compare a new, continuous illumination and short Incubation time regimen of aminolevulinic acid photodynamic therapy#painless-PDT) to a conventional regimen for treatment of Actinic Keratosis. The hypothesis is that the continuous illumination approach will be less or even no painful, but equally efficacious, as the old regimen.

study_design_info.masking_description: Evaluator assesses photographs without prior knowledge of intervention

primary_outcome.measure: The clearance rate of Actinic Keratoses
primary_outcome.description: The change rate in lesion clearance of Actinic Keratoses at six weeks after treatment will be measured as the primary outcome

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately, 1st minute, 3rd minute, 5th minute, 10th minute, 30th minute, 1hour ,2hour, 4hour, 12hour, 24hour,48hour ,72hour
secondary_outcome.description: The pain will be assessed using Vissual Analogue Scale(VAS) with a score range of 0-10.The higher the score,the greater the pain, with 0 being no pain and 10 being the most unbearable pain. Pain will be measured at different time points during and after every treatment

arm_group.description: The painless photodynamic therapy group underwent narrow-band light-emitting diode (LED) irradiation (630 nm; 288 J/cm2) after applying 5% 5-aminolevulinic acid#ALA#cream for 30min. A repeat treatment was administered once every two weeks for 3 times.

The conventional photodynamic therapy(C-PDT) group underwent narrow-band light-emitting diode (LED) irradiation (630 nm; 140 J/cm2) after applying 5% 5-aminolevulinic acid cream for 3h.A repeat treatment was administered once every two weeks for 3 times.

patient_data.ipd_time_frame: One year after finishing this srudy and for permanency
